headline: SEC Fines Morgan Stanley $15 Million Over Failure to Protect Client Accounts
summary: The regulator alleges that Morgan Stanley compliance policies failed to prevent four financial advisors from stealing millions of dollars from clients.

headline: What Makes Morgan Stanley (MS) a New Strong Buy Stock
summary: Morgan Stanley (MS) might move higher on growing optimism about its earnings prospects, which is reflected by its upgrade to a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).

headline: UBS Extends Its U.S. Wealth Arm to Serve More Than Just the Ultrarich
summary: Chasing higher margins, and rivals, the bank’s U.S. boss is making a move for more clients and banking services.

headline: Morgan Stanley Smith Barney to pay $15M penalty to settle SEC charges
summary: Morgan Stanley Smith Barney will pay a $15 million penalty as part of a settlement with the Securities and Exchange Commission related to four financial advisers who stole millions of dollars of advisory clients’ and brokerage customers’ funds.  The settlement announced late Monday is also related to the firm's failure to adopt policies and procedures designed to prevent and detect such theft.  The SEC order said that MSSB failed to adopt and implement policies and procedures reasonably designed to prevent its financial advisers from using two forms of unauthorized third-party disbursements, Automated Clearing House payments and certain patterns of cash wire transfers, to misappropriate funds from customer accounts.

raw.headline: Morgan Stanley Smith Barney to pay $15M penalty to settle SEC charges
raw.summary: Morgan Stanley Smith Barney will pay a $15 million penalty as part of a settlement with the Securities and Exchange Commission related to four financial advisers who stole millions of dollars of advisory clients’ and brokerage customers’ funds.  The settlement announced late Monday is also related to the firm's failure to adopt policies and procedures designed to prevent and detect such theft.  The SEC order said that MSSB failed to adopt and implement policies and procedures reasonably designed to prevent its financial advisers from using two forms of unauthorized third-party disbursements, Automated Clearing House payments and certain patterns of cash wire transfers, to misappropriate funds from customer accounts.

headline: Morgan Stanley Capital Partners Agrees to Acquire Prescott’s
summary: NEW YORK & MONUMENT, Colo., December 10, 2024--Investment funds managed by Morgan Stanley Capital Partners ("MSCP"), the middle-market focused private equity team at Morgan Stanley Investment Management, have agreed to acquire Prescott’s, a leading healthcare focused specialty outsourced clinical engineering services provider, from Atlantic Street Capital. MSCP is partnering with the current management team led by CEO Brian Straeb, who will continue to lead the business.

MSCP is partnering with the current management team led by CEO Brian Straeb, who will continue to lead the business.

headline: Morgan Stanley to pay $15M over theft by now-former employees
summary: The bank failed to detect “hundreds” of instances when brokers misappropriated client funds through unauthorized Automated Clearing House transfers, the SEC said.

raw.headline: Morgan Stanley to pay $15M over theft by now-former employees
